storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive notifications via email for scheduling conflicts to stay informed when away from the system

testCases.title: Verify email notification is sent upon conflict detection
preconditions: User account exists in the system with valid email address
User has scheduler role permissions
Email notification preferences are enabled in user settings
SMTP service is configured and operational
Test email inbox is accessible for verification

steps.action: Log into the system with scheduler credentials
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs in and dashboard is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to user profile settings and locate email notification preferences section
steps.expectedResult: Email notification preferences page is displayed with available options

steps.action: Enable email notifications for scheduling conflicts and enter valid email address
steps.expectedResult: Email notification preference is enabled and email address is saved

steps.action: Click Save or Update button to save preferences
steps.expectedResult: Success message is displayed confirming preferences saved successfully

steps.action: Navigate to scheduling module and create a new schedule entry for a specific resource and time slot
steps.expectedResult: First schedule entry is created successfully

steps.action: Create a second schedule entry that conflicts with the first entry (same resource and overlapping time)
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling conflict is detected by the system and conflict detection process is triggered

steps.action: Wait for email notification to be sent and check the configured email inbox
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is received in the inbox with subject line indicating scheduling conflict

steps.action: Open the email and review the content for conflict details
steps.expectedResult: Email contains accurate conflict details including resource name, conflicting time slots, schedule IDs, and timestamp of conflict detection

postconditions: Email notification is successfully delivered to user inbox
Email delivery status is logged in system
User preferences remain enabled for future conflicts
Scheduling conflict remains in the system for resolution

testCases.title: Validate email delivery status tracking
preconditions: User account exists with valid email address configured
Email notification preferences are enabled
SMTP service is operational
System has access to email delivery logs
User has permissions to view delivery status logs

steps.action: Log into the system with administrator or scheduler credentials
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs in to the system

steps.action: Navigate to scheduling module and trigger a scheduling conflict by creating overlapping schedule entries
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling conflict is detected and email notification process is initiated

steps.action: Navigate to system administration or notification logs section
steps.expectedResult: Notification logs page is displayed with list of sent notifications

steps.action: Locate the test email notification entry in the logs by timestamp or recipient email
steps.expectedResult: Email notification entry is found in the logs

steps.action: Review the delivery status field for the email notification
steps.expectedResult: Delivery status is logged with one of the following states: Sent, Delivered, Failed, or Pending

steps.action: Verify that timestamp of email send attempt is recorded
steps.expectedResult: Timestamp is logged showing when email was sent

steps.action: Check for additional tracking information such as recipient email, subject, and delivery confirmation
steps.expectedResult: All relevant delivery information is logged including recipient, subject line, and delivery confirmation status

postconditions: Email delivery status is accurately logged in system database
Delivery logs are accessible for audit purposes
System maintains complete tracking history of email notifications

testCases.title: Ensure email is sent within 5 minutes of conflict detection
preconditions: User account exists with valid email address
Email notification preferences are enabled
SMTP service is operational with normal latency
System clock is synchronized and accurate
Test environment has access to timestamp logs

steps.action: Log into the system and navigate to scheduling module
steps.expectedResult: User is logged in and scheduling module is displayed

steps.action: Note the current system time before triggering conflict
steps.expectedResult: Current timestamp is recorded for reference

steps.action: Create a scheduling conflict by adding overlapping schedule entries for the same resource
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling conflict is detected and conflict detection timestamp is logged

steps.action: Record the exact timestamp when conflict detection occurs from system logs
steps.expectedResult: Conflict detection timestamp is captured (T1)

steps.action: Monitor email inbox for incoming notification
steps.expectedResult: Email notification arrives in inbox

steps.action: Check the received timestamp of the email in inbox
steps.expectedResult: Email received timestamp is captured (T2)

steps.action: Calculate the time difference between conflict detection (T1) and email received time (T2)
steps.expectedResult: Time difference is calculated in minutes

steps.action: Verify that the time difference is less than or equal to 5 minutes
steps.expectedResult: Email is received within 5 minutes of conflict detection, meeting the performance requirement

postconditions: Email delivery time is within acceptable performance threshold
Timestamps are logged for performance monitoring
System meets the 5-minute SLA requirement for email notifications

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to acknowledge or dismiss conflict alerts to manage my scheduling workflow effectively

testCases.title: Verify user can acknowledge conflict alerts
preconditions: User has scheduler role with appropriate permissions
User is logged into the system
At least one active conflict alert exists in the system
Alert acknowledgment feature is enabled
Database is accessible for persistence verification

steps.action: Log into the system with scheduler credentials
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs in and dashboard is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to the alerts or notifications section of the application
steps.expectedResult: Alerts page is displayed showing list of active conflict alerts

steps.action: Verify that a conflict alert is displayed in the UI with details about the scheduling conflict
steps.expectedResult: Conflict alert is visible showing resource name, time slot, and conflict details

steps.action: Locate the acknowledge button or action associated with the conflict alert
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledge button is visible and enabled for the alert

steps.action: Click the acknowledge button for the conflict alert
steps.expectedResult: System processes the acknowledgment request immediately

steps.action: Observe the UI update after clicking acknowledge
steps.expectedResult: Alert status updates to 'Acknowledged' and UI reflects the change with visual indicator (e.g., different color, icon, or label)

steps.action: Verify that the acknowledged alert remains visible but is marked as acknowledged
steps.expectedResult: Alert is still displayed in the list but clearly marked with acknowledged status

steps.action: Refresh the browser or reload the alert list page
steps.expectedResult: Page reloads successfully

steps.action: Locate the previously acknowledged alert in the refreshed list
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledged alert status is persisted and still shows as 'Acknowledged' after page reload

postconditions: Alert status is updated to 'Acknowledged' in the database
Alert acknowledgment is persisted across sessions
Alert remains in the system for audit trail purposes
User action is logged with timestamp and user ID

testCases.title: Verify user can dismiss conflict alerts
preconditions: User has scheduler role with appropriate permissions
User is logged into the system
At least one active conflict alert exists in the system
Alert dismissal feature is enabled
Database is accessible for persistence verification

steps.action: Log into the system with scheduler credentials
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs in and dashboard is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to the alerts or notifications section of the application
steps.expectedResult: Alerts page is displayed showing list of active conflict alerts

steps.action: Verify that a conflict alert is displayed in the UI with full conflict details
steps.expectedResult: Conflict alert is visible in the active alerts list

steps.action: Locate the dismiss button or action associated with the conflict alert
steps.expectedResult: Dismiss button is visible and enabled for the alert

steps.action: Click the dismiss button for the conflict alert
steps.expectedResult: System processes the dismissal request immediately

steps.action: Observe the UI update after clicking dismiss
steps.expectedResult: Alert is removed from the active alerts view with smooth transition or animation

steps.action: Verify that the dismissed alert is no longer visible in the active alerts list
steps.expectedResult: Alert is completely removed from active alerts display

steps.action: Refresh the browser or reload the alert list page
steps.expectedResult: Page reloads successfully

steps.action: Check the active alerts list for the previously dismissed alert
steps.expectedResult: Dismissed alert is not shown in active alerts list, confirming dismissal is persisted

steps.action: Navigate to alert history or archived alerts section if available
steps.expectedResult: Dismissed alert can be found in history/archive with 'Dismissed' status for audit purposes

postconditions: Alert is removed from active alerts view
Alert status is updated to 'Dismissed' in the database
Dismissal action is persisted across sessions
Alert is moved to history or archived state
User action is logged with timestamp and user ID

testCases.title: Ensure only authorized users can change alert status
preconditions: System has role-based access control configured
At least one active conflict alert exists in the system
Test user account exists without scheduler permissions
Authorization rules are properly configured for alert actions
Error handling is implemented for unauthorized access

steps.action: Log into the system with a user account that does not have scheduler or alert management permissions (e.g., read-only user or viewer role)
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs in with limited permissions

steps.action: Navigate to the alerts or notifications section of the application
steps.expectedResult: Alerts page is displayed, but action buttons may be disabled or hidden

steps.action: Locate a conflict alert in the list and check for acknowledge or dismiss buttons
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledge and dismiss buttons are either not visible or appear disabled for unauthorized user

steps.action: Attempt to click the acknowledge button if visible
steps.expectedResult: Action is blocked and error message is displayed indicating insufficient permissions

steps.action: Verify the error message content
steps.expectedResult: Error message clearly states 'You do not have permission to acknowledge alerts' or similar authorization error

steps.action: Attempt to click the dismiss button if visible
steps.expectedResult: Action is blocked and error message is displayed indicating insufficient permissions

steps.action: Verify the error message content for dismiss action
steps.expectedResult: Error message clearly states 'You do not have permission to dismiss alerts' or similar authorization error

steps.action: Check the alert status in the system
steps.expectedResult: Alert status remains unchanged and no modifications were made

steps.action: Attempt to make direct API call to PATCH /alerts/{id}/status endpoint using unauthorized user credentials
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden or 401 Unauthorized status code with appropriate error message

steps.action: Verify that the unauthorized action attempt is logged in security audit logs
steps.expectedResult: Security log contains entry showing unauthorized access attempt with user ID, timestamp, and action attempted

postconditions: Alert status remains unchanged
No unauthorized modifications are made to the database
Security audit log contains record of unauthorized attempt
System maintains data integrity and security
User receives clear feedback about permission denial

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive SMS notifications for critical scheduling conflicts to ensure timely awareness

testCases.title: Verify SMS notification is sent for critical conflicts
preconditions: User account is active and has Scheduler role
User has a valid phone number registered in the system
SMS gateway integration is configured and operational
User is logged into the scheduling system

steps.action: Navigate to user profile settings and access SMS notification preferences section
steps.expectedResult: SMS notification preferences page is displayed with options to enable/disable SMS alerts for critical conflicts

steps.action: Enable SMS notifications for critical scheduling conflicts and enter valid phone number in international format
steps.expectedResult: Phone number is validated and accepted, SMS preferences are saved successfully with confirmation message displayed

steps.action: Create a scheduling entry that triggers a critical conflict (e.g., double-booking a resource, overlapping time slots for same personnel)
steps.expectedResult: System detects the critical scheduling conflict and initiates SMS notification process

steps.action: Check the registered mobile phone SMS inbox within 3 minutes of conflict creation
steps.expectedResult: SMS notification is received containing conflict type, affected resources/personnel, date/time of conflict, and brief description of the issue

steps.action: Verify SMS message content includes all critical conflict details: conflict ID, schedule names, time overlap, and severity level
steps.expectedResult: SMS contains accurate and complete conflict information matching the detected conflict in the system

postconditions: SMS notification is successfully delivered to user's phone
Delivery status is logged in the system
User is aware of the critical conflict
Conflict remains active in the system until resolved

testCases.title: Validate SMS delivery tracking
preconditions: User account has SMS notifications enabled
Valid phone number is configured in user preferences
SMS gateway is operational and connected
System has logging mechanism enabled for SMS delivery tracking
User has appropriate permissions to view delivery logs

steps.action: Navigate to SMS notification settings and initiate a test SMS notification for critical conflict scenario
steps.expectedResult: Test SMS notification is queued for sending and system generates a unique tracking ID

steps.action: Monitor the SMS gateway response and capture the delivery status callback
steps.expectedResult: SMS gateway returns delivery status (sent, delivered, or failed) with timestamp

steps.action: Access the SMS delivery logs section in the admin or user dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Delivery logs page displays with search and filter options

steps.action: Search for the test SMS notification using tracking ID or phone number
steps.expectedResult: Log entry is found showing SMS details including: recipient phone number, timestamp, delivery status, gateway response code, and message content summary

steps.action: Verify that delivery status is accurately logged with complete metadata (sent time, delivered time, status code)
steps.expectedResult: All delivery information is correctly logged and matches the actual SMS delivery status from the gateway

postconditions: SMS delivery status is permanently logged in the system database
Delivery tracking information is accessible for audit purposes
System maintains complete delivery history
Delivery metrics are updated for reporting

testCases.title: Ensure SMS sent within 3 minutes of conflict detection
preconditions: User has SMS notifications enabled with valid phone number
SMS gateway is operational with normal response times
System clock is synchronized with accurate time source
Conflict detection engine is running and monitoring schedules
Test environment has timing measurement tools available

steps.action: Record the current system timestamp before creating the conflict scenario
steps.expectedResult: Baseline timestamp is captured for performance measurement

steps.action: Create a critical scheduling conflict by double-booking a resource or creating overlapping schedule entries
steps.expectedResult: Conflict is detected by the system and conflict detection timestamp is logged

steps.action: Monitor the SMS gateway logs and system notification queue for SMS processing
steps.expectedResult: SMS notification is queued and sent to the gateway within seconds of conflict detection

steps.action: Check mobile phone SMS inbox and note the time when SMS is received
steps.expectedResult: SMS notification is received on the mobile device

steps.action: Calculate the total elapsed time from conflict detection timestamp to SMS receipt timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Total time elapsed is less than or equal to 3 minutes (180 seconds), meeting the performance requirement

steps.action: Review system logs to verify each stage timing: detection time, queue time, gateway submission time, and delivery time
steps.expectedResult: All timing logs confirm that SMS was processed and delivered within the 3-minute SLA

postconditions: SMS delivery time is logged and meets performance criteria
Performance metrics are updated in the system
User received timely notification of critical conflict
System demonstrates compliance with 3-minute delivery requirement

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive in-app notifications for scheduling conflicts to get immediate feedback while working

testCases.title: Validate real-time in-app notification delivery
preconditions: User is logged into the scheduling application with active session
User has Scheduler role with appropriate permissions
WebSocket or push notification service is active and connected
Browser/application has notification permissions enabled
Conflict detection engine is running

steps.action: Verify user is logged in and the application dashboard is displayed with active connection indicator
steps.expectedResult: User session is active, dashboard is loaded, and real-time connection status shows as connected

steps.action: Create a scheduling conflict by adding an overlapping appointment or double-booking a resource while remaining on the current page
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling conflict is created and saved in the system, triggering the conflict detection engine

steps.action: Observe the application interface for in-app notification appearance without refreshing the page
steps.expectedResult: In-app notification appears immediately (within 1 second) in the notification area, displaying conflict alert with visual indicator (badge, popup, or banner)

steps.action: Click on the in-app notification to expand and read the full conflict details
steps.expectedResult: Notification expands showing complete conflict information including: conflict type, affected schedules, resources involved, time overlap details, and severity level

steps.action: Click the 'Acknowledge' button or action within the notification
steps.expectedResult: Notification status updates to 'Acknowledged', visual indicator changes (e.g., color or icon), and notification smoothly disappears from the active notification list

steps.action: Verify the notification is moved to notification history or acknowledged items section
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledged notification is accessible in history with timestamp and acknowledgment status recorded

postconditions: User is aware of the scheduling conflict
Notification status is updated to acknowledged in the database
Notification is removed from active notifications list
User action is logged for audit trail
Conflict remains in the system until resolved

testCases.title: Verify notification persistence until addressed
preconditions: User is logged into the scheduling application
In-app notification system is operational
User has at least one active scheduling conflict that triggers notification
Notification persistence mechanism is enabled

steps.action: Trigger a scheduling conflict to generate an in-app notification
steps.expectedResult: In-app notification appears displaying the conflict details with actionable buttons

steps.action: View the notification but do not click any action buttons (acknowledge or resolve), then navigate to a different page within the application
steps.expectedResult: Notification remains visible in the notification center or panel, showing unread/unacknowledged status with visual indicator (e.g., red badge, bold text)

steps.action: Log out of the application and then log back in with the same user credentials
steps.expectedResult: After successful login, the unacknowledged notification reappears in the notification center, maintaining its unread status

steps.action: Verify notification counter shows the correct number of pending notifications and notification remains accessible
steps.expectedResult: Notification counter displays accurate count, notification is visible and accessible with all original details intact

steps.action: Click the 'Acknowledge' button on the persistent notification
steps.expectedResult: Notification status changes to acknowledged, visual indicators update (badge count decreases, notification styling changes)

steps.action: Verify the notification is removed from the active notifications list
steps.expectedResult: Notification disappears from the main notification area and is moved to acknowledged/history section, notification counter decrements by one

steps.action: Refresh the page or navigate to another section and return to verify notification does not reappear
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledged notification does not reappear in active notifications, remains only in history section

postconditions: Notification persistence is verified across sessions and page navigation
Acknowledged notification is permanently removed from active list
Notification status is correctly maintained in the database
User cannot miss important conflict notifications

testCases.title: Ensure only authenticated users receive relevant notifications
preconditions: Multiple user accounts exist with different roles and schedule assignments
At least two test users: User A (authorized for Schedule X) and User B (not authorized for Schedule X)
Scheduling conflicts exist or can be created for specific schedules
Authentication and authorization system is properly configured
In-app notification system is operational

steps.action: Log in to the application as User A who is assigned to and has permissions for Schedule X
steps.expectedResult: User A successfully logs in and dashboard displays with schedules they are authorized to access

steps.action: Create a scheduling conflict in Schedule X that User A is responsible for or has access to
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling conflict is created successfully in Schedule X

steps.action: Observe the in-app notification area for User A
steps.expectedResult: User A receives an in-app notification about the conflict in Schedule X, notification contains relevant conflict details specific to their schedule

steps.action: Verify notification details match User A's schedule assignments and permissions
steps.expectedResult: Notification content is relevant to User A's responsibilities, showing only schedules and resources they have access to

steps.action: Log out as User A and log in as User B who does not have access to Schedule X
steps.expectedResult: User B successfully logs in and dashboard displays only their authorized schedules (not including Schedule X)

steps.action: Check the in-app notification center for User B
steps.expectedResult: User B does not receive any notification about the conflict in Schedule X, notification center shows zero notifications or only notifications relevant to User B's schedules

steps.action: Create a new conflict in a schedule that User B is authorized to access
steps.expectedResult: User B receives an in-app notification for the conflict in their authorized schedule, confirming they receive only relevant notifications

steps.action: Verify that User B's notification does not contain any information about Schedule X or other unauthorized schedules
steps.expectedResult: User B's notification contains only information about schedules they are authorized to access, no data leakage from unauthorized schedules

postconditions: Authentication and authorization rules are properly enforced for notifications
Users receive only notifications relevant to their assigned schedules
No unauthorized access to schedule information through notifications
System maintains data privacy and security compliance
Notification filtering by user permissions is verified
